content.1: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:
content.2: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.
content.3: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
content.4: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
content.6: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
content.7: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the
content.8: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.
content.10: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
content.11: My son, despise not the chastening of the
content.20: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
content.21: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:
content.22: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
content.23: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.
content.24: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
content.25: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
content.27: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do
content.28: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.
content.29: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
content.30: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
content.31: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.
content.34: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
content.35: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
